title: Investigation of Electron-Beam-Induced Structural Changes in MgCrMnO4
content: Transition metal (TM) oxides, particularly manganese oxide spinels, are currently attracting considerable attention in rechargeable battery research due to their potential application as cathodes for intercalation of multivalent ions, such as Mg2+ [1]. However, the electrochemical cycling of these oxide cathodes with Mg2+ leads to irreversible structural alterations, resulting in capacity and voltage loss, as reported by multiple studies [2].
